item.title: Chris add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Chris add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Chris add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Chris add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Chris add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Chris add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "In a good bookroom you feel in some mysterious way that you are absorbing the wisdom contained in all the books through your skin, without even opening them." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Chris add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Chris add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Chris add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Chris add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Chris add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Chris add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "People can lose their lives in libraries. They ought to be warned." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Chris add a quote by Jessamyn West
item.description: "Fiction reveals truth that reality obscures." -- Jessamyn West

item.title: Chris add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Chris add a quote by Pseudonymous Bosch
item.description: "Only bad books have good endings. If a book is any good, it's ending is always bad - because you don't want the book to end." -- Pseudonymous Bosch

item.title: Chris add a quote by Cassandra Clare
Chris add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "I am a badass, and I recognize that you, too, are a badass." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Chris add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "My rapier wit hides my inner pain." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Chris add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "If you were half as funny as you think you are, you'd be twice as funny as you are now." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Chris add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "I don't want to be a man," said Jace. "I want to be an angst-ridden teenager who can't confront his own inner demons and takes it out verbally on other people instead." "Well," said Luke, "you're doing a fantastic job." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Chris add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "asdfa" -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Chris add a quote by Cassandra Clare
Chris add a quote by Cassandra Clare
Chris add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "You might want to lie down," Magnus advised. "I find that it helps when the crushing sense of horrible realization sets in." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Chris add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Is this the part where you start tearing off strips of your shirt to bind my wounds?" "If you wanted me to rip my clothes off, you should have just asked." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Chris add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "I'll just have them change the entry in the demonology textbook from 'almost extinct' to 'not extinct enough for Alec. He prefers his monsters really, really extinct.' Will that make you happy?" -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Chris add a quote by Cassandra Clare
Chris add a quote by Cassandra Clare
Chris add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Is standing by the window muttering about blood something he does all the time?" asked Simon. "No," Jace said. "Sometimes he sits on the couch and does it." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Chris add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Declarations of love amuse me. Especially when unrequited." -- Cassandra Clare
